fields.description:
Currently, when viewing an SVG file in a repository, the "source" view displays the rendered image, rather than the source code of the SVG. Hence there is currently no simple way to view the entire source code of SVG files within bitbucket (AFAICT) - only a hacky way via a diff view.

Eg: https://bitbucket.org/tharris/gd-svg/src/af2e386df375fc6cffcb95a1d78c5647e3c0b73c/examples/test_image.svg?at=default\\
(not mine, just the first public one I found)

If someone wants to view the final rendered graphic, the "raw" button is available for that purpose, so the "source" tab should show the actual image source code.
fields.summary: Show raw, unrendered contents of text-based images (SVG, XPM, etc) in diffs

fields.description:
When using the console at:

http://restbrowser.bitbucket.org/

*steps to reproduce:*

* using the deploy-keys POST support setup (assume it is the case for all of the api endpoints)
* select the "body" tab.
* clicking on the "see resource document" url next to the parameters entries.
* click on the "see resource document" link.
* see that you are taken to: https://apigee.com/console/twitter

fields.description: When an issue is not assigned to anyone, can we have an "assign to me" link instead so that we can avoid having to edit the issue each time we pick an issue?
fields.summary: Feature request: "Assign to me" link

fields.description:
My signup experience made me almost walk away from bitbucket, here's how it went:

# fill in all information, type in CAPTCHA\\
(at this point, I've passed the CAPTCHA test, I'm a human, all subsequent tests are irritants)
# name already taken, correct and type in a new CAPTCHA
# missed a required field, correct and type in a new CAPTCHA
# didn't add a team member, correct and type in new CAPTCHA

etc...

# Now, file a bug report on the overuse of CAPTCHA in bitbucket, enter a new CAPTCHA.
fields.summary: Suppress reCAPTCHAs on subsequent signup pages once a user has passed one (BB-8990)
Add direct link to browse-source-at-revision from changeset page (BB-8991)

fields.description:
Hi there,

I have a service running that uses the API to add a deployment key to an account.

For all of my users this works successfully _except one_ where they experience a 404 message from the Bitbucket API when trying to add a deploy key.

trying to add a key to: https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/rowilliams/TestRepo/deploy-keys/

What is the 404 not found for (no more info in the response from what I can see).

And why does this only affect one user?
fields.summary: 404 when calling create against a Bitbucket Deploy keys API endpoint for one user

I'm trying to get an openid account working.  Management want to see if we can add 2 factor authentication, I think it should work with google account and google authenticator.

Sign up seems to work, but when I confirm my email address, I get:

"We are not currently accepting new OpenId signups"\\
See attached screenshot

May be the documentation can be made a bit clearer.

fields.description:
The short story is that "close issue BCLOUD-33" works as expected but "closes issue BCLOUD-33" does not.

Whether the text is in the message of a commit that gets merged in as a pull request, or in the message of the merge commit itself, "close" ALWAYS works and "closes" NEVER works.

"See" works as expected, adding a comment to the issue with a reference to the commit.

I have not tried the other verbs.
fields.summary: Problem with auto-closing issues when merging pull request (BB-8985)

fields.description:
Bug in issue info panel.

Steps to reproduce:

# create issue
# press Stop watching - watcher count became 0
# press Watch this issue

Expected result: watcher count need to be 1\\
Actual result: watcher count "-1"
fields.summary: Race condition in javascript watchers link (BB-8986)

fields.description:
Hi there. Bitbucket stopped allowing one of my team members to push changes with the following error:

Pushing to git@bitbucket.org:giganticplanet/geek-parents.git

conq: the account owner 'giganticplanet' has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository 'geek-parents'.

fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

--\\
How can this be resolved? We created one new account for a web service which triggered this error - and after that message was received we removed an unnecessary team member from the repo.

What else is there to do??
fields.summary: Write access disabled to my repository?

fields.description:
I would like to give some warnings about the profile and setting pages in bitbucket.org. It allows remote attackers to do some clickjacking which can be used for adding arbitrary tasks in users' task list. Why? Almost all of your page has missing X-FRAME-OPTIONS header.

Websites are at risk of a clickjacking attack when they allow content to be embedded within a frame. An attacker may use this risk to invisibly load the target website into their own site and trick users into clicking on links which they never intended to. An "X-Frame-Options" header should be sent by the server to either deny framing of content, only allow it from the same origin or allow it from a trusted URIs.

Here is an example PoC video done by Aditya Gupta, Subho Halder and Dev Kar for Google Plus: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W0fTFHCxXBY (They got a hall of fame for this demo).

Vulnerability Reference: http://www.troyhunt.com/2013/05/clickjack-attack-hidden-threat-right-in.html

Google and Facebook has patched this kind of simple exploit/vulnerability.\\
Solution: Add a header to explicitly describe the acceptable framing practices (if any) for this site.

For example, here’s what Facebook does:

_X-Frame-Options: DENY_

And that's why you cannot include Facebook anymore in an iframe .

Attached is my PoC screenshot too using the link https://bitbucket.org/repo/create.

Regards,

Jay Turla
fields.summary: Bitbucket Allows Potential Clickjacking -- set X-Frame-Options (BB-8983)

fields.description:
When viewing a merged pull request, it would be extremely beneficial to list the commit ID associated with the merge commit.

On a page with the URL pattern:

https://bitbucket.org/{company}/{repo}/pull-request/{pull-id}/{pull-description}/diff

There is, as best I can tell, no way at all to determine the merge commit associated with the pull request. The _only_ solution is to click the destination repository, then click the branch name, then manually scroll/search through the commit list looking for the pull request.

fields.description:
Hello,

When i'm doing a "git ls-remote" the last line contain weird  characters : ^{}

Example from github :

{code}
From https://github.com/heroku/node-js-sample.git
f0a7d6b6cf64f408601c1597064cea05835a5f61        HEAD
0b1bfe178869ba23a07cb118c362b29878b9a13e        refs/pull/1/head
a5a98d8deaef0d89e2b872dea45576ba835e159a        refs/pull/1/merge
....
94f75ca3ca6fd59e57aa44d997d138b4c6589900        refs/pull/9/head
13b657144cbe8329bd2eeb6330fed67f5a959899        refs/pull/9/merge
{code}

From bitbucket :

{code}
From https://TheRedCat@bitbucket.org/TheRedCat/oh-my-games-gestion-de-projet.git
518b6e814081ad63d1c5710bcea6061a6d6a6f5d        HEAD
518b6e814081ad63d1c5710bcea6061a6d6a6f5d        refs/heads/master
68ccad6b2b9eadc4b54f441d5041c30e3bc091e7        refs/tags/1.0
518b6e814081ad63d1c5710bcea6061a6d6a6f5d        refs/tags/1.0^{}

{code}

The "^{}" shouldn't be there.

This is a problem for automated-deployment tools like capistrano.
fields.summary: Weird git ls-remote output

After pulling today I randomly encountered this error:

remote: Counting objects: 18, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (16/16), done.\\

fields.description:
When trying to change the commit point of a source file, the drop-down appears after clicking on the current commit button as usual. However, the loading image is displayed but not replaced with a list of commit points for that file. This happens in Source and Diff pages the majority of the time i attempt to use it.

After looking at the console log i have found this error: "Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property '1' of null" after trying to select a new commit point.

I am using a Windows 8 PC running Google Chrome Version 28.0.1500.72 m. This isn't a major issue however it does limit the functionality of some of Bitbucket's features.
fields.summary: Javascript error in commit dropdown (BB-8951)

fields.description: You are adding new columns like "milestone", "version", now "vote". Please look now what happens with the issue page, especially at the "title" column (which I believe is the most important one). I don't use a big display, only that one on my laptop, and it's 1366x768. You cannot expect that all people use >=24'' or something to get a good layout on that page.
fields.summary: The issue tracker layout is getting worse when a new column is added (BB-8950)

fields.description:
This is really very annoying, because everyone who posts "+1" does not really help with a constructive comment, but keeps spamming all the watchers' email inboxes.

Solutions that I suggest:

# Don't allow comments less than {{N}} characters in this tracker
# Deny comments consisting only of "+1" (stripped of whitespace) with an error message, explaining that user should use voting feature
# Automatically convert "+1" to votes

In my personal opinion, the third solution is the best.
fields.summary: Don't allow people to post +1 on an issue tracker (BB-8952)

fields.description: It is a security flaw to allow users to be listed on the site; which is what this does. The workflow is also weird if you're trying to send pull requests to team-members only, and it keeps showing you unrelated people. It should be possible to filter it to team members for the searching, and just flat-out not return searches for users not in a team.
fields.summary: Search for reviewers should be limited to lookup team-members, and not be a wildcard search

fields.description:
In a pull request on a private repo belonging to sandvineps (details can be provided off-thread), a number of comments were made across multiple files, but all of them were deemed outdated within a few hours, without any commits since the comments were made.  This was noticed after some comments were replied to, so I'm not sure if the replies triggered this, or if there were marked outdated for some other reason.

We use comments in pull requests as as register of open issues for a feature branch, so for us, and anyone else who uses comments the same way, this is a critical bug that disrupts our workflow.
fields.summary: All comments in pull request marked outdated with no commit

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice if when displaying Markdown READMEs in the repository overview, users can *disable syntax highlighting altogether* for code blocks.

I've been trying to find a way to do this to no avail in the following Bitbucket documentation.\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Display+README+text+on+the+overview

I only need something really simple like the following example. In the example, the flag {{lang-none}} forces no syntax highlighting.

Contents of README.md

{code}
```lang-none
$ even though this looks like a shell session due to the dollar signs
$ do not try to guess the language or perform any syntax highlighting
```
{code}
fields.summary: Markdown Force Disable Syntax Highlighting

fields.description:
My understanding is that the remote HEAD (the HEAD symbolic-ref in my Bitbucket repository) points to the head of the default branch. As such, HEAD in my Bitbucket repository resolves to the same commit as master (i.e. origin/HEAD and origin/master are the same for me).

Lets say I've created a branch "develop" and I want that branch to be the default branch. I select that as my default branch in the repository.

I would expect that the HEAD symbolic reference in my Bitbucket repository to be changed to develop and as such I should see origin/HEAD be the same as origin/develop. Instead, the reference does not change - it is still referencing master.

See also the following. Apparently changing the default branch in github manages the HEAD as I've described.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1485578/how-do-i-change-a-git-remote-head-to-point-to-something-besides-master/2962737
fields.summary: Changing the default branch does not affect remote HEAD

but it will be great if a pull request could be started and linked from a certain commit onwards until the pull is accepted or rejected

fields.description:
When our brokers post to a remote server, but the post body empty (e.g. for Bamboo), Bitbucket doesn't send a {{Content-Length}} header, causing the requests to time out or fail with a 405.

This is a [known bug|http://code.google.com/p/httplib2/issues/detail%3Fid%3D143] in httplib2 that we need to work around.
fields.summary: Service brokers should send Content-Length (BB-8934)

fields.description:
Hi,

When I merge to a branch, the POST service sends me the following data:\\
payload:

{code:text}
{
 "repository": {
  "website": "",
  "fork": false,
  "name": "august-rest-api",
  "scm": "git",
  "owner": "chrisbk",
  "absolute_url": "/chrisbk/august-rest-api/",
  "slug": "august-rest-api",
  "is_private": true
 },
 "truncated": false,
 "commits": [],
 "canon_url": "https://bitbucket.org",
 "user": "cdow"
}
{code}

The problem is that there is no information about the branch there.  I can work around this to suit my needs, but it is a bit silly that there is basically no useful information in the POST.  Also, I'm setting this as a bug because the actual behavior is pretty far from the expected behavior and the docs do not explain this.
fields.summary: POST service does not provide useful information when merging to a branch (BB-8954)

fields.description: See [BB-8931|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8931]
fields.summary: compare view doesn't always load list of commits (BB-8931)

fields.description:
Rather than describe the problem, I'll just show some examples:

What you put in the editor:

{{[Roses are ``rose.getColor()``](http://google.com/)}}

What comes out:

[Roses are {{rose.getColor()}}|http://google.com/]

What you put in the editor:

{{[Roses are `rose.getColor()`](http://google.com/)}}

What comes out:

[Roses are {{rose.getColor()}}|http://google.com/]
fields.summary: Putting backticks in anchor text breaks the formatter. (BB-8935)

fields.description:
Hg pull, push, incoming and outgoing, etc. commands regularly take around a minute to complete on our private and paid for company repos (account: exmachina).

The repos I use are generally not large (around 10MB).

There seems to be some sort of caching involved as often, after a few successive commands the speed improves. At such a time the performance can reach a normal level where commands only take a couple of seconds to complete.

I use https to access the repos.

Strangely, when I access the same repos through the web interface I do not experience similar lag.

Here's a traceroute (I've done a few and haven't seen any noticeable spikes in those):

{code}
#!sh
$ traceroute -I bitbucket.org
traceroute: Warning: bitbucket.org has multiple addresses; using 131.103.20.168
traceroute to bitbucket.org (131.103.20.168), 64 hops max, 72 byte packets

fields.description:
Copy and paste the following- Actually, you can't. Please refer to the attached image for the snippet that crashes the Markdown renderer.

The original issue was with the wiki. If I typed in the snippet shown in the image and previewed, it would throw an error about rendering. If I ignored the error and saved the wiki page, I would be unable to view the page (until I get the wiki repo and remove the offending snippet..)

But.. It would appear that the bug is in any component that uses the Markdown renderer, including the issue tracker.. I bet if I had filed this issue by typing in the snippet directly, no one would be able to view this. What irony it would have been, eh?
fields.summary: Markdown renderer crashes with this snippet (BB-8932)

fields.description:
I created an account using the same email address for id and bitbucket (bitbucket account was created first). I have been attempting the "Confirm" my email address via "resend confirmation" on the bitbucket application but the email doesn't get sent anymore. When I did get the emal, clicking on the "Confirm email" link in the email would take me to the Atlassian ID login, not the Bitbucket email confirmation page. I have attempted to delete and recreate the Bitbucket account with no success. I was able to add and confirm a different email address with my account but this is not my primary address. The problem seems to only exists with the email that is being used on both accounts.

Note: I had to remove hylander0@hotmail.com email address in order to submit this Issue.  This is also related to https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/190422/unable-to-confirm-email-address-also-used-as-my-atlassian-id-in-bitbucket

I encounter the same problem as Issue BCLOUD-6406.

git push is stalling out on large files:

$ git push Counting objects: 3755, done. Delta compression using up to 8 threads. Compressing objects: 100% (3708/3708), done. Writing objects: 9% (334/3708) <- this never ends

environment is windows/Git-1.8.3-preview20130601.exe.

Searching the internet - it looks more that a missconfigured sshd is on your side. Please check!
fields.summary: git push with ssh causes remote end to hang up

fields.description:
Within the past few days something has changed in the implementation of the event URI which causes the HTTP 'Content-Type' header to alternate from 'application/json' to 'text/html'. I believe it has something to do with a caching mechanism since it seems to report the correct Content-Type in a first request and subsequent requests return the 'text/html' Content-Type:

My first request to: https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/thedillonb/events/\\
Returns: Content-Type →application/json; charset=utf-8

My second request to: https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/users/thedillonb/events/\\
Returns: Content-Type →text/html; charset=utf-8

And will continue to return 'text/html' for a while.

The body is still JSON in both cases but the 'Content-Type' is incorrect in some cases.
fields.summary: REST API: Event URI Has Changing Content-Type Header
Using a  non-http URI Scheme

fields.description:
I'm using diffmerge as my favourite tool on both Windows and Mac OS X platforms. On Windows it works fine, but on my Mac OS X the Diffmerge opens but doesn't load any files - the window is clean. I'm currently using Kdiff3, which just works fine, but I would prefer Diffmerge.

TortoiseHg version: version 2.8.2+1-54b677d8da4f\\
Diffmerge version: 3.3.2\\
(I tried 4.0.0, but it didn't help this issue)

in my .hgrc:

{code}
#!ini

[extdiff]
cmd.kdiff3 = /Applications/kdiff3.app/Contents/MacOS/kdiff3
cmd.diffmerge = /usr/bin/diffmerge

[ui]
merge = kdiff3

[merge-tools]
kdiff3.args = $base $local $other -o $output
diffmerge.executable = /usr/bin/diffmerge
diffmerge.args = -merge -result=$output -t1="Local Version" -t2=$output -t3="Other Version" -caption=$output $local $base $other
diffmerge.binary = False
diffmerge.symlinks = False
diffmerge.gui = True

{code}
fields.summary: Mac OS X port: TortoiseHg opens Diffmerge but no files are loaded

fields.description:
The API allows posting issues but only if authenticated with a valid account if the repository is a private one, even when the issue tracker is public:\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/issues+Resource

It doesn't make sense to have a feature missing from the API that is available through the ordinary browser.  It would be very useful to allow anonymous issue posting this way, since it would enable the development of apps that have an internal bug reporting feature.

(however, anonymous issue posting in browser also appears broken at the time of writing - see issue BCLOUD-7751)
fields.summary: API does not allow posting anonymous issues

fields.description:
Using Chrome Version 28.0.1500.71 m, attempting to post an anonymous issue on a public issue tracker that allows anonymous posting:\\
!http://i.imgur.com/oV62AJU.png!

{code}
Input error: Invalid referer
This field is required.
{code}

(despite all required fields being filled in)

This is under a custom domain, and the repository itself is private.  I suspect this is a recent problem, since I recall being able to post such issues anonymously before.
fields.summary: Anonymous issue posting broken (BB-8916)

fields.description:
Currently when creating or forking a repository the URL slug for the repository is generated automatically. When the repository name has a "special" character such as ä, ö, å and so on, it gets simply converted to a dash (-).

For repository names that have many of these characters the semantic meaning of the repository URL slug is lost. For example "Yömyöhässä" becomes "y-my-h-ss-" (instead of "yomyohassa"), which by itself is not of use and might confuse people about what the resource actually represents.

This is not limited to ä, ö or å. Other special characters, that might be used in daily written languages in some languages, should be properly converted. These three letters in my example are quite vital for northern european languages.

(At least I could not find an option to change the generated URL slug to a different value.)
fields.summary: Convert "äöå" characters to "aoa" in repository URL slugs

fields.description:
Currently when you are using OAuth according to the [instructions here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/OAuth%2Bon%2BBitbucket], the Step 3 is to "Redirect the user to Bitbucket to authorize your application". Now, the page that the user is redirected to is, by default, the login page. On a mobile browser it's a quite terrible user experience: the user must zoom in and scroll around just to log in!

Please make the login page to scale gracefully to small screens. If the current page cannot be made to do that, please create a new page and allow the authentication URL requester to specify the type of login page they want as a parameter in the call.

(Attached: screenshot from Chrome for Android on Samsung Galaxy Nexus.)
fields.summary: OAuth login page to support mobile browsers (BB-8927)

fields.description:
I use the standard BitBucket website in my iPad without problems. However, when I create a bookmark for the homescreen, the generated icon is built from a screenshot of the page, which is really not attractive (see attached screenshot - all them are bookmarks icons created from Safari).

There is a way to define a custom bitmap that iOS will take for generating the homescreen icon as suggested in the attached screenshot. it is really quiet easy to add this functionality to BitBucket

You can find a short tutorial at the end of my article at codeproject: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/423158/Visual-Studio-debug-console-for-iPhone
fields.summary: Home screen icon for iOS (BB-8894)

fields.description:
Hi,

I noticed there are quite some posts on the subject already, but none seem to adequately describe my problem.

We, as an organisation, host the code of a couple of our projects here on bitbucket. For one of these projects, we have a Continuous Integration server, that pulls in the code on every commit. Since a month or two, suddenly all builds began to fail with the message: "conq: repository access denied."

Logging in to this machine, and trying stuff like "git ls-remote" to debug the problem, also issues this error. I (re)checked my ssh- and git configuration, like described by you guys in [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Set%2Bup%2BSSH%2Bfor%2BGit] and [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Troubleshoot%2BSSH%2BIssues] document, and everything seems in order.

Now comes the weirdest part:\\
On the server I tried to clone the repo of the project in a temp folder. This failed with the same conq error again.\\
Then I tried to clone the repo of another project we host here on bitbucket in the temp folder, and tada, that worked! This is quite strange, because I did not add the deployment key of the machine to that project at all.

So, somehow the server is able to successfully setup a ssh connection to bitbucket (it can clone repo's), so the ssh settings on the machine are probably correct, but for some specific repo's the connection fails. This conclusion seems correct, right?

I'm quite puzzled now, so any ideas or suggestions are highly appreciated!
fields.summary: Another "conq: repository access denied." issue

fields.description: I can not set workflow as resolve status. When i click resolve or workflow-->resolved , then it display error. (An unexpected error)
fields.summary: Workflow resolve fix issue

Thanks a million

Improve source browser to show more data instead of diff too big (BB-8890)

fields.description:
Github [now provides OAuth tokens|https://github.com/blog/1270-easier-builds-and-deployments-using-git-over-https-and-oauth] as an authentication mechanism for pulling/cloning repositories. Do you have a plan/timeline for implementing this?

Currently, the only way to deploy private repositories onto platforms like [Heroku|http://heroku.com] (that don't allow private SSH keys) is to explicitly use username/password credentials, which aren't easily revokable and pollute logs & source control with credentials (which is bad!).
fields.summary: Allow HTTP access to repositories via OAuth (BB-8891)
When autocompleting usernames in issue comments and descriptions, list project members first
